title: Arvind Kejriwal Slams BJP Over Blockage of Welfare Schemes in Delhi - The Times of India
summary:
Arvind Kejriwal Accuses BJP of Hindering Welfare Schemes in Delhi

Published on: October 2023

Source: Times of India

Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has publicly accused the BJP of obstructing welfare schemes aimed at empowering women and enhancing healthcare services in Delhi. He pledged to implement a new Mahila Samman scheme and the Sanjeevani Yojana.

  • Kejriwal claims that the BJP is blocking the execution of essential welfare programs.
  • The Mahila Samman initiative focuses on women's economic and social empowerment.
  • The Sanjeevani Yojana aims to strengthen healthcare services across Delhi.
“The BJP is not allowing the government to deliver welfare services to the people of Delhi,” said Kejriwal.

This confrontation highlights the ongoing political tensions between the AAP and the BJP in Delhi.
newTitle: Arvind Kejriwal Accuses BJP of Hindering Welfare Schemes in Delhi

title: Madras High Court orders SIT probe into Anna University sexual assault, directs ₹25 lakh compensation for victim - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Madras High Court Orders SIT Probe into Anna University Sexual Assault Case

Published on: 28 Dec 2024, 7:47 am, Source: Unknown

The Madras High Court has directed a Special Investigation Team (SIT) to investigate the sexual assault of a 19-year-old student from Anna University, amidst concerns of police negligence in handling the case.

  • The Court ordered an interim compensation of ₹25 lakh to the victim.
  • Police are instructed to provide protection to the victim and her family.
  • A SIT will be formed with three Indian Police Service officers due to the ongoing investigation's shortcomings.
  • The High Court condemned the victim-blaming language in the First Information Report (FIR).
  • The Court highlighted the need to protect women's rights and dignity.
"The deplorable language of the FIR paves the way for victim blaming. It is shocking."

In conclusion, the Court emphasized that the society must work towards protecting women and ensuring that they do not face judgment based on their gender.
newTitle: Madras High Court Orders SIT Probe into Anna University Sexual Assault Case

title: Periya double murder: Court finds 14 guilty including CPM ex-MLA Kunhiraman, acquits 10, to award sentence on Jan 3 - Onmanorama
Supreme Court livid after Punjab says "helpless" to provide medical aid to Jagjit Dallewal - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court livid after Punjab says "helpless" to provide medical aid to Jagjit Dallewal

Published on: 28 Dec 2024, 7:28 am

The Supreme Court expressed strong discontent regarding the Punjab government's claim of being unable to provide medical aid to Jagjit Singh Dallewal, a farmer's leader on a hunger strike, amidst ongoing protests.

  • The Punjab government argued that other protesting farmers were obstructing their attempts to grant medical aid.
  • The Supreme Court reiterated that Punjab must comply with previous orders to provide necessary medical assistance.
  • The Court provided additional time for the State to comply with its directions, suggesting assistance from the Central government if needed.
  • The Court heard a contempt petition against the Chief Secretary for not complying with an order requiring Dallewal’s hospitalisation.
  • Justice Kant criticized the farmers for preventing medical aid, labeling such actions as unacceptable.
“When you (eventually) give him some aid, it may be too little too late.” — Justice Dhulia

The Court emphasized strict adherence to its orders and scheduled the next hearing for December 31.
newTitle: Supreme Court Unhappy with Punjab's Inaction on Medical Aid for Farmer Leader

title: NDA created 'unnecessary controversy' over Manmohan Singh's cremation, memorial: Ashok Gehlot - The Hindu
summary:
Gehlot Accuses NDA of Controversy Over Manmohan Singh's Memorial

Publication Date: December 28, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Ashok Gehlot, former Rajasthan chief minister, criticized the NDA government for creating unnecessary controversy surrounding the cremation and memorial of former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh.

  • Gehlot claims public pressure led to BJP's plans for a future memorial for Singh.
  • Manmohan Singh, the architect of India's economic reforms, passed away at 92.
  • Gehlot highlighted inconsistencies in how the BJP has handled tributes to leaders from different parties.
  • Singh's last rites were conducted at Nigam Bodh Ghat, a location Gehlot argues is not special enough for a leader of Singh's stature.
“The NDA government has created an unnecessary controversy over the cremation and memorial of a great personality like Dr Manmohan Singh.” - Ashok Gehlot

In summary, Gehlot's comments reflect broader concerns about the treatment of prominent political figures and the legacy of Singh's contributions to India.
newTitle: Gehlot Accuses NDA of Controversy Over Manmohan Singh's Memorial

title: All flights cancelled at Srinagar airport after heavy snowfall - Greater Kashmir
Snowfall grounds 80% flights at Srinagar airport - Greater Kashmir
summary:
Severe Snowfall Causes Major Flight Cancellations at Srinagar Airport

Date: Dec 27

Source: Greater Kashmir

Flight operations at Srinagar airport have been severely impacted, with 80% of flights cancelled due to ongoing snowfall and low visibility, despite a clear runway.

  • 80% of flights cancelled and 10% on standby, likely facing cancellation.
  • Visibility too low for landings, confirmed by Srinagar Airport Director Javed Anjum.
  • Airlines affected include Indigo, SpiceJet, and GoAir.
  • Possible resumption of flights if weather improves later in the day.
“The snowfall has led to the cancellation of about 80% of flights. The remaining 10% are on standby and are also likely to be cancelled as visibility continues to remain low,” Anjum said.

Flight operations are highly dependent on weather improvements, affecting numerous travelers and schedules.
newTitle: Severe Snowfall Causes Major Flight Cancellations at Srinagar Airport

title: 'Congress didn't even bother to call': Pranab Mukherjee’s daughter hits out at party amid Manmohan Singh - The Times of India
Manipur CM Biren condemns firing by militants in Imphal East district - The Hindu
summary:
Manipur CM Biren Condemns Indiscriminate Firing by Militants

Published on: December 28, 2024 - Source: The Hindu

Manipur Chief Minister N. Biren Singh has strongly condemned the recent firing by militants in Imphal East which left four injured. He characterized the attack as a cowardly act against innocent lives.

  • The firing occurred in Thamnapokpi and Sanasabi areas.
  • Four individuals were injured, including a video journalist who was shot in the thigh.
  • The CM stressed the need for calm and unity in light of the violence.
  • Security forces have been deployed to the affected areas to restore order.
  • The injured are receiving necessary medical assistance.
"Strongly condemn the indiscriminate firing by Kuki militants at Sanasabi and Thamnapokpi in Imphal East, which injured civilians and security personnel. This cowardly and unprovoked attack on innocent lives is an assault on peace and harmony." — N. Biren Singh

The incident highlights ongoing tensions and violence in the region, prompting calls for better coordination among security forces.
newTitle: Manipur CM Biren Condemns Indiscriminate Firing by Militants

title: Video: How cops cleared 1,000 vehicle jam in Himachal Pradesh - Hindustan Times
summary:
How Police Rescued Tourists from a Major Traffic Jam in Himachal Pradesh

Date: December 28, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Himachal Pradesh faced severe traffic congestion with 1,000 vehicles stranded near Solang Nala due to heavy snowfall and an influx of tourists. Kullu police successfully rescued around 5,000 stranded tourists in a continuous operation.

  • Heavy snowfall led to one of the worst traffic jams in Himachal Pradesh's history, impacting thousands.
  • The Kullu police coordinated a massive rescue operation to evacuate the stranded tourists.
  • Authorities are working to clear blocked roads amid ongoing snow and continue to face challenges due to severe weather conditions.
  • The India Meteorological Department issued alerts for heavy snowfall and cold waves across several districts.
“Due to fresh snowfall today on 27.12.2024, about 1,000 tourists and other vehicles were stuck in Solang Nala.” - Kullu Police

This event highlights the challenges faced by local authorities during peak tourist seasons impacted by extreme weather conditions.
newTitle: How Police Rescued Tourists from a Major Traffic Jam in Himachal Pradesh

title: Major power outage in Kashmir after snowfall, restoration expected by evening: Omar Abdullah - Greater Kashmir
KTR Gets ED Summons In Car Race Scam - Gulte
summary:
KTR Receives ED Summons in Formula Car Race Case

Published on: 10:02 am, 28 December 2024

The farmer IT minister of Telangana, KTR, is facing legal charges related to the formula car race case and has been summoned by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) to appear for investigation on January 7.

  • KTR received the ED summons as part of a legal inquiry regarding the prevention of money laundering act claims made by the Anti Corruption Bureau (ACB).
  • Other individuals linked to the case have also been called for questioning on January 2 and 3.
  • The investigation includes considerations under the Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA) related to potential unauthorized fund transfers.
  • This represents the first official summons for KTR in this ongoing case.
  • The core allegation involves questionable consent for a ₹55 transfer to a foreign entity without proper approvals.
The summoning of KTR could signify significant legal developments ahead.

This case is poised to yield intense scrutiny and may influence the political landscape in Telangana.
newTitle: KTR Receives ED Summons in Formula Car Race Case

title: BRS Leader KTR Summoned By Probe Agency In Formula E Racing Case - NDTV
summary:
BRS Leader KTR Summoned By Probe Agency In Formula E Racing Case

Publication Date: January 2024

Source: New Delhi

The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned BRS leader and former Telangana minister KT Rama Rao regarding financial irregularities tied to the Formula E race in Hyderabad.

  • KTR is scheduled to appear on January 7, with other officials on January 2 and 3.
  • Allegations involve unauthorized transfers totaling Rs 55 crore from the HMDA to Formula E Operations Limited.
  • Additional transfers of Rs 54.8 crore for future races are under investigation.
  • This is the second money laundering case related to the family of former Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao.
This marks another political and legal challenge for the BRS party.

The unfolding events signal potential repercussions for the BRS party amidst ongoing scrutiny.
newTitle: BRS Leader KTR Summoned By Probe Agency In Formula E Racing Case

title: Govt agreed to memorial for Manmohan Singh, Congress now playing politics: BJP - The Hindu
summary:
BJP Accuses Congress of Playing Politics Over Memorial for Manmohan Singh

Publication Date: December 28, 2024

Source: The Hindu

The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has announced its decision to construct a memorial for former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh while accusing the Congress party of politicizing the issue.

  • The BJP stated that it is committed to honoring Manmohan Singh’s contributions to India's economic development.
  • A memorial and mausoleum will be built in his memory, a decision that was communicated to Congress leadership prior.
  • The Congress has claimed it wanted Manmohan Singh's cremation to take place at a location suitable for a memorial, but the ceremony occurred at Nigambodh Ghat.
  • BJP spokesperson Sudhanshu Trivedi criticized Congress for their perceived lack of respect towards Singh.
“Congress party, who never respected Dr. Manmohan Singh in their lifetime, today even after his death, they are seen doing politics.” - Sudhanshu Trivedi

The BJP insists that the memorial will be built following necessary legal protocols, reinforcing their commitment to respecting Singh's legacy.
newTitle: BJP Accuses Congress of Playing Politics Over Memorial for Manmohan Singh

Kanpur: Pregnant Minor Accuses Family Members of Rape

This article discusses a shocking case in Kanpur where a pregnant minor has accused her father, grandfather, and uncle of rape.

title: Sandhya 70mm victim’s husband to withdraw case against Allu Arjun; Cops say not possible - 123telugu
summary:
Husband to Withdraw Case Against Allu Arjun in Sandhya 70mm Incident

Published on Dec 28, 2024 | Source: 123telugu

The tragic stampede during the premiere of Pushpa 2 on December 4 resulted in the death of Revathi and severely injured her son Sritej. In the wake of these events, her husband Bhaskar expressed his intention to withdraw the complaint against Allu Arjun.

  • The stampede at Sandhya 70mm theater claimed the life of a 35-year-old woman.
  • Bhaskar received a cheque of Rs 2 crore and a job offer from the film fraternity.
  • Despite Bhaskar's intention to withdraw the case, police stated they would proceed with legal action due to the gravity of the incident.
  • Allu Arjun was previously arrested but is currently out on interim bail.
“The stampede had resulted in the loss of a valuable life,” stated police officials.

The situation is still dynamic as police are preparing to file a chargesheet against Allu Arjun and others involved. This incident raises significant questions about safety at public events in the film industry.
newTitle: Husband to Withdraw Case Against Allu Arjun in Sandhya 70mm Incident

title: ‘Utter rubbish…’: Pranab Mukherjee's daughter Sharmistha slams Congress amid Manmohan Singh memorial row - Hindustan Times
summary:
Sharmistha Mukherjee Criticizes Congress Over Memorial Controversy for Manmohan Singh

Date: Dec 28, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

Sharmistha Mukherjee, daughter of former president Pranab Mukherjee, criticized the Congress party for not convening a Congress Working Committee (CWC) meeting after her father’s death in 2020, while supporting a request for a memorial for former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh.

  • Sharmistha stated the Congress didn’t hold a CWC meeting after Pranab Mukherjee's passing.
  • She referenced diary entries showing that a CWC meeting was held for K.R. Narayanan's passing.
  • Despite criticism, she supports a memorial for Manmohan Singh, who passed away at 92.
“When baba passed away, Congress didnt even bother 2 call CWC 4 condolence meeting. That’s utter rubbish...” - Sharmistha Mukherjee

In conclusion, Sharmistha Mukherjee’s remarks highlight ongoing tensions within the Congress party regarding how it honors its leaders, contrasted with her support for a memorial for Manmohan Singh.
newTitle: Sharmistha Mukherjee Criticizes Congress Over Memorial Controversy for Manmohan Singh

In the wake of recent violence, Manipur Chief Minister Biren Singh has condemned the indiscriminate firing by Kuki militants that has affected several communities in the region.

  • The Chief Minister stated that security has been rushed to the affected areas.
  • Local communities are expressing outrage at the ongoing violence.
  • There are calls for better protection for civilians and accountability for the militants.
“Such violence cannot be tolerated in a civilized society,” said CM Singh.

title: Allu Arjun appears before court virtually in Sandhya Theatre stampede case, cites security reasons - Hindustan Times
summary:
Allu Arjun Appears Virtually in Sandhya Theatre Stampede Case

Date: Dec 28, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Actor Allu Arjun appeared virtually before a local court regarding his bail in the Sandhya Theatre stampede case, where a woman died due to a stampede at his film's premiere.

  • Allu Arjun is accused in a case related to a stampede during the premiere of his film Pushpa 2: The Rule.
  • The incident occurred on December 4, resulting in the death of a 35-year-old woman and injuries to her son.
  • The hearing for his bail plea has been postponed to December 30.
  • Allu Arjun had been arrested earlier and was granted interim bail.
“Allu Arjun appeared citing security reasons and to avoid public inconvenience.”

The case continues to attract public and media attention as it raises questions about crowd management during film premieres.
newTitle: Allu Arjun Appears Virtually in Theatre Stampede Case

title: Manmohan Singh funeral LIVE updates: Former PM’s last rites at Nigambodh Ghat in Delhi - The Hindu
summary:
Manmohan Singh funeral LIVE updates: Former PM’s last rites at Nigambodh Ghat in Delhi

Date Published: December 28, 2024 - Source: The Hindu

Former Prime Minister Dr. Manmohan Singh will receive a State funeral at Nigambodh Ghat on Saturday, December 28, 2024.

  • The funeral is scheduled to begin at 11:45 a.m.
  • Dr. Singh's body will be at the AICC headquarters for public viewing from 8:30 a.m. to 9:30 a.m.
  • A state-sanctioned memorial will be allocated for Dr. Singh in the future.
  • Several dignitaries, including the current Prime Minister and former officials, are expected to pay their respects.
“Dr. Singh’s final journey will commence from the headquarters to the cremation ground at 9:30 a.m.” - K. C. Venugopal

The public and political figures are invited to gather and pay their last respects to a leader known for his economic policies and international diplomacy.
newTitle: Manmohan Singh Funeral Live Updates

title: India's development priorities were key to Manmohan Singh's foreign policy - The Times of India
Heavy Rain In Delhi Causes Severe Waterlogging, 'Orange' Alert Issued: Latest Weather Updates - News18
summary:
Heavy Rain In Delhi Causes Severe Waterlogging, 'Orange' Alert Issued: Latest Weather Updates

Date: December 27, 2024
Source: News18

Delhi experienced heavy rainfall and lightning on December 27th, prompting an 'orange' alert from the weather department due to severe waterlogging.

  • The temperature in Delhi was recorded at 13 degrees Celsius early in the morning.
  • Heavy rain is expected to continue for the next two days, with thunderstorms and potential hailstorms forecasted in surrounding areas.
  • Delhi's air quality remains 'very poor,' with a slight improvement noted.
  • The India Meteorological Department issued warnings for hailstorms across several northern states.
“The maximum temperature is expected to reach 20 degrees Celsius, with continuous rain and intensified fog.”

This weather event highlights the ongoing challenges faced by the national capital and its efforts in managing severe weather conditions.

title: Congress demands memorial for Manmohan Singh; committed to building one: Government - The Times of India
summary:
Congress Demands Memorial for Manmohan Singh; Government Committed to Building One

Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

The Indian Congress party is advocating for the establishment of a memorial for former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, with the government indicating its commitment to fulfilling this demand.

  • The Congress party believes a memorial would honor Singh's contributions to the nation.
  • The government has acknowledged the request and plans to take necessary steps toward its realization.
  • This initiative reflects Singh's legacy in Indian politics, particularly in economic reforms.
“A memorial for Manmohan Singh is essential to recognize his pivotal role in shaping modern India,” said a Congress leader.

The effort to create a memorial highlights the ongoing reverence for Manmohan Singh's leadership and policies that have had lasting impacts on the country.
newTitle: Congress Demands Memorial for Manmohan Singh; Government Committed to Building One

title: Govt to implement Freedom of Religion Act: CM - The Arunachal Times
summary:
Govt to Implement Freedom of Religion Act: CM

Date: 27 Dec, Source: Arunachal Times

Chief Minister Pema Khandu announced that the Arunachal Pradesh Freedom of Religion Act, 1978, which has been inactive, will soon be implemented following a directive from the Gauhati High Court.

  • The Act aims to prohibit forced or fraudulent religious conversions.
  • Khandu emphasized the importance of preserving indigenous faiths and cultures in Arunachal Pradesh.
  • The process for framing the rules for implementing the Act is currently underway.
  • Khandu expressed gratitude for contributions by the Indigenous Faith and Cultural Society of Arunachal Pradesh in preserving cultural identity.
  • The government established the indigenous affairs department in 2017 to protect indigenous cultures and languages.
“Both faith and culture cannot walk separately.” - Chief Minister Pema Khandu

This move is seen as crucial for the preservation of Arunachal's unique cultural heritage.
newTitle: Govt to Implement Freedom of Religion Act: CM

title: Snowfall paints Kashmir white - Greater Kashmir
summary:
Snowfall Paints Kashmir White

Date: December 27, 2022

Source: Greater Kashmir

The recent snowfall in Kashmir has delighted locals and tourists alike, marking the end of a prolonged dry spell. However, it has also caused significant disruptions to traffic and air travel.

  • Kashmir received its first snowfall of the season, affecting Srinagar and various districts.
  • Traffic disruptions were reported on major routes, including the Srinagar-Jammu National Highway.
  • Seven flights were cancelled at Srinagar International Airport due to heavy snow and low visibility.
  • The Meteorological Department predicted continued snowfall in higher altitudes.
  • Roads leading to the Chenab Valley and Pir Panjal regions are likely to remain closed for months due to heavy snow accumulation.
  • Local authorities are advising caution due to potential landslides and slippery conditions on roads.
“I drove from Jammu to Srinagar today. It snowed continuously from Banihal to Srinagar. The conditions were quite treacherous.” - Omar Abdullah, Chief Minister

This significant snowfall has not only brought joy for winter tourism but also presents challenges for infrastructure and safety on the roads.
newTitle: Snowfall Paints Kashmir White, Bringing Joy and Disruption

Shocking & deliberate insult: Congress, SAD slam Centre over Manmohan Singh's last rites, memorial

An uproar has ensued as Congress and the Shiromani Akali Dal criticize the Central government for its handling of former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh's last rites and memorial.

title: Excavation conducted, measurement done for police outpost opposite Shahi Jama Masjid in U.P.’s Sambhal - The Hindu
summary:
Excavation conducted, measurement done for police outpost opposite Shahi Jama Masjid in U.P.’s Sambhal

Date: December 27, 2024 Source: The Hindu

The construction of a new police outpost in Sambhal aims to enhance security following recent tension in the area.

  • Heavy police presence is established at the site for the new outpost.
  • Measurements for the outpost have been successfully completed by local authorities.
  • The outpost will ensure 24/7 police presence in the region.
  • A bulldozer accident occurred during excavation, causing damage to a nearby house but no casualties were reported.
  • The initiative follows violent clashes on November 24 that resulted in multiple fatalities.
“The construction of the post will ensure 24x7 presence of police in the area,” said Additional Superintendent of Police (ASP) Shirish Chandra.

This police outpost is a proactive measure to restore security in a community recently affected by violence and unrest.
newTitle: Excavation and Measurement for New Police Outpost in Sambhal, U.P.

title: Manmohan Singh’s funeral at Nigambodh ghat, Congress calls it deliberate insult to first Sikh PM - The Hindu
summary:
Manmohan Singh’s funeral at Nigambodh ghat, Congress calls it deliberate insult to first Sikh PM

Published on: December 27, 2024 - Source: The Hindu

The Ministry of Home Affairs has ordered a State funeral for former Prime Minister Dr Manmohan Singh at Nigambodh Ghat, which has sparked controversy with the Congress party calling it a deliberate insult to Singh's legacy.

  • Dr Manmohan Singh passed away at the age of 92.
  • The Congress demanded a funeral location suitable for a memorial.
  • The decision for Nigambodh Ghat was made after discussions between Congress leaders and government officials.
  • Senior Congress leaders expressed that the choice of location is viewed as disrespectful.
  • Dr Singh was a highly revered figure, recognized for his significant contributions to India.
“This is nothing but a deliberate insult to the first Sikh Prime Minister of India, Dr. Manmohan Singh,” said Congress communication chief Jairam Ramesh.

The government's decision has sparked a broader discussion about how national leaders are honored in death and the significance of memorials for their contributions.
newTitle: Manmohan Singh's Funeral Sparks Controversy Over Location Choice
